title: CMS Commits to Improved Care Quality, Medical Spending Cuts
description: CMS will continue to work toward creating a better healthcare system for patients while keeping close track of medical spending.
body: CMS will continue to work toward creating a better healthcare system for patients while keeping close track of medical spending.

title: Why Value-Based Care Reimbursement, MACRA are Here to Stay
description: The overall trajectory of the healthcare industry has been moving toward value based care reimbursement in order to cut rising medical spending.
body: The overall trajectory of the healthcare industry has been moving toward value based care reimbursement in order to cut rising medical spending.

title: Value-based care, an elusive concept, enters the curriculum
description: As more medical schools formalize high-value care in their curricula, a new health systems science textbook is helping to provide a framework for instruction.
body: As more medical schools formalize high-value care in their curricula, a new health systems science textbook is helping to provide a framework for instruction.

title: Why Patient Satisfaction is More Than "Making Patients Happy"
description: Patient satisfaction must center on meeting patient needs, ultimately improving care outcomes and the patient experience, says Press Ganey's Deirdre Mylod.
body: Patient satisfaction must center on meeting patient needs, ultimately improving care outcomes and the patient experience, says Press Ganey's Deirdre Mylod.

title: What does consolidation mean for the future of healthcare? 6 things to know
description: The trend of hospital and health system consolidation will continue to mount in the coming years, but it is unclear if this changing healthcare landscape will improve value for consumers, according to a new report published by the Healthcare Financial Management Association.
body: The trend of hospital and health system consolidation will continue to mount in the coming years, but it is unclear if this changing healthcare landscape will improve value for consumers, according to a new report published by the Healthcare Financial Management Association.

title: CMS Equity Plan Promotes Data Analytics, Population Health
description: Improved data analytics are required to inform population health management strategies to reduce socioeconomic health disparities, CMS says.
body: Improved data analytics are required to inform population health management strategies to reduce socioeconomic health disparities, CMS says.

title: How digital records could improve mental health care
description: Better documentation is crucial to improve continuity of care, but stakes are raised even higher when it comes to protecting patients' mental health records.

title: How healthcare organizations can anticipate IT demands of new consumers
description: Providers need to be planning ahead to determine how they'll meet the technology and service expectations of diverse generations, says Anil Jain, MD.
body: Providers need to be planning ahead to determine how they'll meet the technology and service expectations of diverse generations, says Anil Jain, MD.

title: Top 5 tips for combatting 2017 coding concerns
description: The calendar may say the ICD-10 transition is long gone, but practices still will likely feel its repercussions in 2017 in terms of payer requests, denials and the new code set's influence on value-based care. Looking to next year, practices should start being proactive with these coding opportunities now to consider how the following five factors will impact documenting, coding and billing for care
body: The calendar may say the ICD-10 transition is long gone, but practices still will likely feel its repercussions in 2017 in terms of payer requests, denials and the new code set's influence on value-based care. Looking to next year, practices should start being proactive with these coding opportunities now to consider how the following five factors will impact documenting, coding and billing for care
context: Read this article from Medical Economics on 5 tips for combating medical coding concerns in 2017.

title: Prioritizing Preventive Value-Based Care with Big Data Analytics
description: Providers need the big data analytics competencies required to succeed with prediction and prevention - the fundamental keys for success with value-based care.
body: Providers need the big data analytics competencies required to succeed with prediction and prevention - the fundamental keys for success with value-based care.

source.network: Enterprise Innovation | Asia's Premier Business and Technology Publication

title: Harnessing the healthcare data revolution
description: The impact of this data revolution has not only resulted in better patient care but also the ability to make data correlations and identify patterns in a way not possible before. When all medical information is stored in one place and is accessible by any authorized healthcare practitioner, a lot more can be learned from insights gathered through data analytics.
body: The impact of this data revolution has not only resulted in better patient care but also the ability to make data correlations and identify patterns in a way not possible before. When all medical information is stored in one place and is accessible by any authorized healthcare practitioner, a lot more can be learned from insights gathered through data analytics.

title: In Trump's Presidency, Value-Based Purchasing, Health IT Must Push Forward
description: The results of last week's presidential election were extremely unexpected to many, and in the days that followed, debates in media and social circles took front and center for many of us. Those discussions will likely not cease any time soon, but in a time of great uncertainty, it's important to focus on what we know rather than what's now behind us.
body: The results of last week's presidential election were extremely unexpected to many, and in the days that followed, debates in media and social circles took front and center for many of us. Those discussions will likely not cease any time soon, but in a time of great uncertainty, it's important to focus on what we know rather than what's now behind us.

title: A New World of Bundled Payments is Upon Us: Are Hospitals Ready?
description: In July, the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) continued its bold endeavor into the world of value-based healthcare with an announcement that introduced a mandatory bundled payment for care for heart attacks and for cardiac bypass surgery.
body: In July, the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) continued its bold endeavor into the world of value-based healthcare with an announcement that introduced a mandatory bundled payment for care for heart attacks and for cardiac bypass surgery.
